hints.Data Collection: Gathering relevant data from various sources, such as surveys, databases, or web scraping.
hints.Data Cleaning: Preparing and organizing data by removing errors, inconsistencies, and duplicates.
hints.Data Types: Understanding the different types of data, such as categorical, numerical, and ordinal.
hints.Data Summarization: Condensing large datasets into smaller, more understandable representations.
hints.Data Exploration: Examining data to identify patterns, trends, and relationships.
hints.Descriptive Statistics: Using measures like mean, median, mode, and standard deviation to describe data.
hints.Inferential Statistics: Making predictions and generalizations about a population based on sample data.
hints.Hypothesis Testing: Evaluating the validity of a claim or hypothesis using statistical tests.
hints.Correlation and Covariance: Measuring the strength and direction of the relationship between two variables.
hints.Regression Analysis: Modeling the relationship between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables.
hints.Time Series Analysis: Analyzing data points collected over time to identify trends, seasonal patterns, or other temporal structures.
hints.Data Visualization Techniques: Representing data graphically, such as bar charts, line charts, pie charts, and scatter plots.
hints.Dashboards and Reporting: Creating interactive and dynamic visual displays to communicate insights and findings.
hints.Dimensionality Reduction: Reducing the number of variables in a dataset while preserving its essential information.
hints.Machine Learning Basics: Using algorithms to learn from data and make predictions or decisions based on new, unseen data.
